title: How to Make a Bacon, Spinach, Tomato and Swiss Cheese Frittata

steps.headline: Cook bacon in a heavy skillet.
steps.description: Remove from skillet and place on paper to drain. Press paper to remove excess fat.

steps.headline: While bacon is cooking, dice tomatoes.
Crack eggs into mixing bowl and beat well.
Drain fat from skillet.
steps.description: Wipe with paper towel if needed to get rid of excess fat.

steps.headline: Heat pan over medium heat.
steps.description: Add a little butter to the pan if desired.

steps.headline: Add tomatoes, and chopped bacon to pan.
Pour eggs over the vegetable and bacon mixture.
Cook over medium-low heat for few minutes until eggs begin to set.
Add cheese to top of dish.
Remove skillet from stove, place in oven.
Cook for 10-15 minutes until done.
steps.description: Can finish with the broiler if desired.

text: Preheat over to 400 degrees.  Cook bacon in a heavy skillet. Remove from skillet and place on paper to drain. Press paper to remove excess fat. While bacon is cooking, dice tomatoes.  Chop bacon.  Crack eggs into mixing bowl and beat well. Add milk if desired. Drain fat from skillet. Wipe with paper towel if needed to get rid of excess fat. Heat pan over medium heat. Add a little butter to the pan if desired. Add spinach to the pan. Quickly wilt spinach. Add tomatoes, and chopped bacon to pan.  Pour eggs over the vegetable and bacon mixture.  Cook over medium-low heat for few minutes until eggs begin to set.  Add cheese to top of dish.  Remove skillet from stove, place in oven.  Cook for 10-15 minutes until done. Can finish with the broiler if desired. Finished.
